title: New Release – Publio
content:
Publio is small unusual and unique font family, characterized with sharp, triangular semi-serifs.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Publio_Poster1_3915.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Publio_Poster2_5174.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Publio_Poster3_5682.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Publio_Poster4_4418.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Publio_Poster5_5199.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Publio_Poster6_4007.jpg)

Available at (or it will be soon):

[MyFonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/new.myfonts.com/foundry/Tour_de_Force/)  
 [FontSpring](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/www.fontspring.com/foundry/tour-de-force)  
 [YouWorkForThem](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/designer/354/tour-de-force-font-foundry/)  
 [Fonts.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/searchresults.htm?foundry=Tour+de+Force+Font+Foundry)  
 [FontDeck](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/fontdeck.com/foundry/tourdeforce)  
 [ITC Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/searchresults.htm?st=5&cid=Tour+de+Force+Font+Foundry&pg=1)  
 [Linotype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/www.linotype.com/808063/tourdeforcefontfoundry-library.html)  
 [Type.co.uk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414044112/http:/www.type.co.uk/a_to_z_listing/supplier/65)
author: tourdeforce

comments.content:
I like it! Good luck.

hhp
This looks great! Reminds me of Rotis Semi Serif, but I like Publio far better. Very graceful, especially in the italics.

This is a tour de force! (Pun emphatically intended.)

grshutters: "Reminds me of Rotis Semi Serif, but I like Publio far better." I concur.
